column4: how does the packaging of ubuntu compared with debian? is fiesty fawn comparable to debian 'stable'? what would be comparable to debian 'testing'?
which is the released version of ubuntu?
fiesty fawn is a released version?
how can something be call a software release if it is still changing?
but fiesty fawn is based on debian's 'unstable', which is changing.
the core of ff will not change until the next release
